item.title: Really our job
item.dc:creator: @gothic_queen casey.
item.description:
@gothic_queen wrote:

Hidendra:

are new mods ever getting dots? it gets annoying to go to irc to request a a dot/ban

I don’t know, we got them because we’ve been here a while and are highly trusted, I guess you could say.

Read full topic

item.title: Really our job
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“Tree, post:43, topic:236532”][quote author=hasumon link=topic=312186.msg2514347#msg2514347 date=1225486282]

Tico doesn’t use mscp anymore like all global mods, so don’t event bother him.
The new mods are really good at getting to things and locking them, but that’s all they can do. When I mod I use my warn hammer a lot.

are new mods ever getting dots? it gets annoying to go to irc to request a a dot/ban

Since the new mod’s first impressions ( me specifically ) were soo bad, we would never get a chance to have dot powers.
[/quote]

My pet rock could do a better job than you.[/quote]
io9 did a better job than they could…

Read full topic

item.title: Really our job
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“io9, post:38, topic:236532”][quote author=sanga282 link=topic=312186.msg2488942#msg2488942 date=1224001093]

Sometimes you just have to grit your teeth and bear with it. Trust me when I say you aren’t the only one copping heat. :rolleyes:

sdfu fag admin lol!!!

lol Yz seems harsh lothy is cool you should let me help you lothy you know how much i would enjoy to inflict punishments on those idiots out there, and i would be efficient
[/quote]
That didn’t work with me, trust me.[/quote]
yeah but imho you didnt bring the hammer down hard enough you did great and were a step in the right direction but the punishments arent harsh enough and the dongs dont even get seen that much ive made like tonnes of reports and in the end gave up and just send tico IRC messages but now hes GM so that fucks things up he was like only guy that did much tbh
also: i’ve jsut looked in tut section and there are a tonne of locks but no one got warned !? you wonder why no one pays attention to the mods

Read full topic

item.title: Really our job
item.dc:creator: @ry60003333 ry60003333
item.description:
@ry60003333 wrote:

thiefmn6092:

I wasn’t really arguing that, nor am I saying it should be allowed everywhere. Just drives me insane these religious fanatics want to force their beliefs on everyone else.

Same. We have religious freedom in the US, so people can’t say that “same sex marriage should be banned because it goes against god”. And in Ohio, same sex marriages are not recognized by the state. So for a straight couple, if one got injured, the other could make decisions for them. However, if you in a same sex marriage, the state doesn’t recognize your marriage, and you lose the rights and protections that others have.

I personally don’t give a care about same sex marriages. Its their choice, it doesn’t effect me, and we used to have laws against marriages of different races, which is obviously legal now.

Read full topic

item.title: Really our job
item.dc:creator: @thiefmn6092 thiefmn6092
item.description:
@thiefmn6092 wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:35, topic:236532”][quote author=thiefmn6092 link=topic=312186.msg2494667#msg2494667 date=1224336767]

It is in Ohio where I live!

that would probably change if it was challenged in court.

Not necessarily. If it isn’t unconstitutional then there’s nothing a judge can do about it.

but, nowhere in the constitution is it said it has to be between a Man and a Woman.
[/quote]
Nowhere in your constitution does it say that marriage is allowed between same sex couples. Therefore preventing same sex marriage through statute is not unconstitutional, not illegal, and not a place that the courts can go.
The statute in place preventing same sex marriage couldn’t be challenged on the basis of legality.

I suppose they could challenge it on the basis of human rights, but I don’t think that would fly in America.[/quote]

I wasn’t really arguing that, nor am I saying it should be allowed everywhere. Just drives me insane these religious fanatics want to force their beliefs on everyone else.

Read full topic

item.title: Really our job
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

[quote=“thiefmn6092, post:28, topic:236532”][quote author=Lothy link=topic=312186.msg2493695#msg2493695 date=1224284866]

It is in Ohio where I live!

that would probably change if it was challenged in court.

Not necessarily. If it isn’t unconstitutional then there’s nothing a judge can do about it.
[/quote]
but, nowhere in the constitution is it said it has to be between a Man and a Woman.[/quote]
Nowhere in your constitution does it say that marriage is allowed between same sex couples. Therefore preventing same sex marriage through statute is not unconstitutional, not illegal, and not a place that the courts can go.
The statute in place preventing same sex marriage couldn’t be challenged on the basis of legality.

I suppose they could challenge it on the basis of human rights, but I don’t think that would fly in America.

Read full topic
